snippet: Vice Marshal Ri Yong-ho, who was a chief mentor to the North’s new leader, has been removed from all his posts because of illness, state media reported Monday.
abstract: Vice Marshal Ri Yong-ho, the chief of the General Staff of the North’s People’s Army, is dismissed because of 'illness'; his removal and the way in which it was handled are bound to spawn speculation among North Korea analysts; the inner workings of political power in North Korea are shrouded in mystery, with top officials often demoted, made to disappear, reinstated or killed in suspicious accidents.
lead_paragraph: Vice Marshal Ri Yong-ho, who was a chief mentor to the North’s new leader, has been removed from all his posts because of illness, state media reported Monday.

headline.main: North Korea Removes Its Army Chief From All His Posts
headline.print_headline: North Korea Removes Its Army Chief From All His Posts
